vishnu_story.definition: Lord Vishnu is one of the principal deities of Sanatana Dharma, known as the preserver and protector of the universe in the Hindu Trinity (Trimurti).

origin.roots: Vedic tradition evolving into Puranic texts

appearance: Four arms holding Shankha (conch), Chakra (discus), Gada (mace), and Padma (lotus).
Crown and yellow garments representing divinity and purity.
attributes.vehicle: Garuda (eagle) – symbol of speed and strength.

major_legends.name: Churning of the Ocean (Samudra Manthan)
major_legends.summary: Vishnu took the form of Kurma (tortoise) to support Mount Mandara during the churning of the ocean for Amrita (nectar of immortality).

major_legends.name: Vamana Avatar
major_legends.summary: As a dwarf Brahmin, Vishnu humbled King Bali by covering the universe in three steps, restoring cosmic balance.

major_legends.name: Krishna Avatar
major_legends.summary: Vishnu incarnated as Krishna to guide humanity through the Bhagavad Gita and destroy evil forces like Kamsa.

major_legends.name: Rama Avatar
major_legends.summary: Vishnu incarnated as Rama to uphold Dharma and defeat Ravana in the Ramayana.

ten_avatars_(dashavatara): Matsya (Fish) – Saved life during the great flood.
Varaha (Boar) – Rescued Earth from demon Hiranyaksha.
Kalki – Future avatar to end Kali Yuga.

festivals.name: Vaikuntha Ekadashi
festivals.significance: Day of fasting and devotion to Vishnu for liberation.

philosophical_significance.vaishnavism: Vishnu is supreme reality; devotion (Bhakti) leads to Moksha.
philosophical_significance.bhagavad_gita: Teaches Dharma, Karma Yoga, and surrender to God.

vishnu_dashavatara_with_morals.definition: The ten avatars of Vishnu (Dashavatara) represent divine interventions to restore Dharma and cosmic balance.

avatars.name: Matsya (Fish)
avatars.story: Saved Manu and sacred scriptures during the great flood.
avatars.moral: Preserve knowledge and righteousness even in times of crisis.

avatars.name: Kurma (Tortoise)
avatars.story: Supported Mount Mandara during Samudra Manthan.
avatars.moral: Patience and stability are essential for achieving great goals.

avatars.name: Varaha (Boar)
avatars.moral: Protect nature and uphold balance in creation.

avatars.name: Narasimha (Man-Lion)
avatars.moral: Faith and devotion triumph over arrogance and tyranny.

avatars.name: Vamana (Dwarf)
avatars.story: Humbled King Bali by covering the universe in three steps.
avatars.moral: Humility and wisdom overcome pride and ego.

avatars.name: Parashurama
avatars.story: Destroyed corrupt Kshatriyas to restore Dharma.
avatars.moral: Justice must prevail over misuse of power.

avatars.name: Rama
avatars.story: Defeated Ravana and upheld Dharma in Ramayana.
avatars.moral: Live by truth, honor, and righteousness even in adversity.

avatars.name: Krishna
avatars.story: Guided humanity through Bhagavad Gita and destroyed evil forces.
avatars.moral: Perform your duty selflessly and surrender to divine will.

avatars.name: Buddha
avatars.moral: Peace and empathy are the highest virtues.

avatars.name: Kalki (Future Avatar)
avatars.story: Will appear to end Kali Yuga and restore Dharma.
avatars.moral: Truth and justice will ultimately prevail over chaos.

vishnu_dashavatara_with_morals.symbolism: Each avatar represents a stage in evolution and a principle of Dharma restoration.

philosophical_significance.vaishnavism: Dashavatara illustrates divine intervention to maintain cosmic order.
philosophical_significance.ethics: Teaches humility, courage, compassion, and righteousness.
